name: 社會語言學研討
comment: 教室位於雲和街大樓2樓（地址：雲和街1號），外系及外校學生需申請門禁權限。

goals: To get deeper knowledge and research capabilities in the field of sociolinguistics.
To develop independent and critical thinking.
To understand and explore differences across languages, ethnic groups, and cultures.
To apply theory to local communities, languages, and policies.
syllabus:
此課程為社會語言學領域之進階課程，探討立場 (stance taking), 認同 (identity)，語言使用 (language use) 和語言意識形態 (language ideology) 之間的關係。學生需先修習ENC 2026 Sociolinguistics （或其他同等課程）尚能修習此課程。

This advanced course in sociolinguistics explores the intricate relationship between stance taking, identity, language use, and language ideology. ENC 2026 Sociolinguistics (or other equivalent courses) is the prerequisite for this course.

This course aims to deepen students’ knowledge of sociolinguistics and develop their critical thinking and independent researching ability. Students will better understand the linguistic and perspectival differences across languages, cultures, and social groups, which enables them to apply their knowledge of sociolinguistics to language-related issues in the local communities.  

Week 1: Overview  
 

Week 2-4: Language & Identity

Sub-topics: identity in variation sociolinguistics; discourse and identity; theorizing language and identity

Week 5-7: Indexicality

Sub-topics: icon, index, and symbol; direct and indirect indexicality; indexical order; indexicality and identity

Week 8-10: Stance-taking

Sub-topics: the stance triangle; stance in sociolinguistics; stance and identity

Week 11-13: Language ideology

Sub-topics: language attitude and language ideology; identity and language ideology; metapragmatics

Week 14: How do these concepts intersect? How do these concepts relate to the local issues in Taiwan?

Week 15-16: Wrap-up & final presentations
prerequisite: Prerequisite course: 【ENC2026  Sociolinguistics】 ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
